result.execSummary:
The defendant JC V Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence deemed served. Each count concur.

Reporter: Teri Groves
Atty White requests re-referral to BMP or lower cash bail.  State gives argument.  State agrees with reducing bail and re-referral to BMP, along with reinstatement of original bail conditions.  Court grants motion.  If defn is terminated from BMP, $10,000 cash bond reinstated.

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT RE-REFERRED TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with BMP, Cash Bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000. per case, as higher Cash Bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.  BMP will be removed as a condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with J.B. or James W.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not be in the 4900 Blk of Packers Ave, Madison
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Mario D. White in court on behalf of defendant.   Corey Stephan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-25-2014 at 01:15 pm.
Atty White appointed 02/26/2014
Status conference on March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
The Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500 per case on the condition that the Def reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the Def fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.  If Def posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM.  If Def is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with J.B. or James W.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not be in the 4900 Blk of Packers Ave, Madison
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant appeared.  Cara J Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The Court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500 per case on the condition that the Def reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the Def fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.  If Def posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM.  If Def is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with J.B. or James W.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not be in the 4900 Blk of Packers Ave, Madison
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
